plunden - (10:00): Hello. Just installed XWiki Enterprise 2.1.1 on Glassfish 2.1.1 successfully. However, I had to replace the cglib-2.1\_3.jar with cglib-2.2.jar before XWiki began to work right.  
plunden - (10:02): Seems very similar to this: http://lists.xwiki.org/pipermail/users/2009-December/018675.html

xwiki-bridge - (17:10): [anamarias] hi  
xwiki-bridge - (17:10): [lucaa] hi anamarias  
xwiki-bridge - (17:10): [anamarias] I'm trying to use XWiki.widgets.Notification to display messages in a Ajax request  
xwiki-bridge - (17:11): [anamarias] and I came up with smth like: http://ana-s-private-labs.pastebin.com/d46fe8714  
xwiki-bridge - (17:11): [anamarias] but it doesn't seem that right to me with the notif.hide() call all the time  
xwiki-bridge - (17:11): [lucaa] I can't really help you in there. Maybe sdumitriu ?  
xwiki-bridge - (17:12): [sdumitriu] Yep  
xwiki-bridge - (17:12): [anamarias] what would be a better approach? (I looked at other code and use all kind of fields and objects, but I need smth simple)  
Lukemon\_ joined #xwiki at 17:12  
xwiki-bridge - (17:13): [sdumitriu] anamarias: Did you try using replace?  
xwiki-bridge - (17:13): [anamarias] it's signature is:   replace : function(notification) {  
xwiki-bridge - (17:13): [anamarias] doesn't it replace just the message?  
xwiki-bridge - (17:14): [anamarias] I need to change the type too  
xwiki-bridge - (17:14): [sdumitriu] notification is another Notification object  
xwiki-bridge - (17:14): [sdumitriu] So something like:  
xwiki-bridge - (17:14): [sdumitriu] notif.replace(new XWiki.widgets.Notification("msg", "type"))  
xwiki-bridge - (17:15): [anamarias] great, i didn't realize that  
xwiki-bridge - (17:15): [anamarias] thanks  
arkub left at 17:25 (verne.freenode.net irc.freenode.net

arkub joined #xwiki at 17:31  
Lukemon\_ joined #xwiki at 17:31  
xwiki-bridge - (17:42): [Lady Serena Kitty] I upgraded to XEM 2.1.1 last night.  :D  
xwiki-bridge - (17:42): [Lady Serena Kitty] the new layout is nice  
xwiki-bridge - (17:42): [sdumitriu] Hey Lady Serena Kitty  
xwiki-bridge - (17:42): [glerouge] thks Lady Serena Kitty  
xwiki-bridge - (17:43): [glerouge] any remarks about it?  
xwiki-bridge - (17:43): [glerouge] easier / harder to use, better / worse looking, anything else ?  
xwiki-bridge - (17:43): [glerouge] more / less convenient ?  
xwiki-bridge - (17:43): [Lady Serena Kitty] it makes things a lot easier  
xwiki-bridge - (17:44): [Lady Serena Kitty] wiki/space up at the top, page stuffs over the content  
xwiki-bridge - (17:44): [glerouge] cool :) that's what it was intended to do  
xwiki-bridge - (17:44): [Lady Serena Kitty] its easier because one doesn't have to think about the menus anymore  
xwiki-bridge - (17:45): [Lady Serena Kitty] with the 2.0 layout, it was always liek "is this menu entry for the system or for this content?"  
xwiki-bridge - (17:45): [glerouge] <:o)  
xwiki-bridge - (17:45): [Lady Serena Kitty] and the menu icons also make things easier  
xwiki-bridge - (17:45): [Lady Serena Kitty] so, good work with the layout update!  =^\_^=  
xwiki-bridge - (17:46): [Lady Serena Kitty] 4.9/5 Paws  
xwiki-bridge - (17:47): [glerouge] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (17:47): [Lady Serena Kitty] and try as I might, I just can't seem to remove the /bin/ part on my XWiki installation  
xwiki-bridge - (17:47): [Lady Serena Kitty] :(

lucaa joined #xwiki at 19:50  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:54): Lady Serena Kitty: To get the full benefit of the upgrade, yes.
